author: erol312006
title: great set
review:
pros -  
- 2 new clone pilots
- 1 new astro droid
- new 2 x 4 tile plates
- new windsileds that actually stays on now
 
cons -
- kit fisto  still has a rubber head.      why not a new jedi like ayyla secura ???
- hate the stickers on the windshileds
- the price  65.00  for a set with less then 400 pieces.   lego this is plastic not gold...

overall fun set to build

author: Commander_Bly
title: Awesome set!
review:
This set is so great! I really loved it from the minute I opened it after buying it at my local Super Target, and it is an awesome build and an a just totally-beastly set! Here are the pros and cons:

Pros:
 - Kit Fisto, a rare minifigure
 - Two totally new minifigures, Captain Jag and the pilot
 - Three cockpits of a slighty better design
 - Awesome engines
 - Really cool green astromech droid
 - Very fun build
 - Sleek design
 - Lots of good pieces, could go along with the V-19 Torrent

Cons:
 - Price is a bit high at $60, I think it would be better at something more like $45 or $50
 - The stickers are a bit annoying
 - The side wings are difficult to keep up

It took me 2 hours to build it.

This is overall a great set I recommend you get it soon!

author: Jcc2224
title: Great classic Episode III set!
review: This is a very nice set. The new helmets for Captain Jag and Clone pilot are very cool, with the open visor. The back torrent is loose and will not stay in one direction for long. The wings that fold out are a similar mechanism to the X-Wing. The long slope bricks on the side are empty, so thats nice storage for Kit Fisto's Lightsaber. The droid socket for the nice new R4-P44 is built like the old one. The fold out cockpitscan break off when not pushed then pulled. 4/5. Walmart is a good place to get it! ;)

author: ThreeSheets
title: My brother and I love this Set !
review:
To me the Arc-170 is a combination 6212 X-Wing and 7674 V-19 Torrent. It was amazing with the wings open and close feature. The set includes stickers. It includes the new window  in the Freeco Speeder. (8085) 

Pros pilot: minifigs are extremely detailed, flick fires really work, wings open and close.


Cons: should include another clone pilot,Kit Fisto is not so detailed, tail gun moves to much.

author: shiloa437
title: arc 170 starfighter YAY!
review:
Got the last one of this set from toys ur us took a while too build cuz i kept messing up on the wings but it turned out good (asside from the fact i got dirt in the stickers so i took them off and threw them away) i like this one better than the older one except the minifgs.I preffer the older pilots and kit fisto's face weares off easily i mean cmon lego you could have done better!But i love the artoo unit!

Pros:easier too build than other

Cons:Stickers,kit fisto's face weares off and clone pilot helmets look like marshmellows.

Otherwise this set is pretty awesome!

author: StarWarsLegoFan123
title: Yay!
review:
Before I say something pointless and meaningless, lets get to the Pros and Cons.

Pros:

1. Cool mini-figures! :)
2. Nice look
3. Good wing opening mechanism
4. You don't have to flick the flick fire missiles!
5. Easy to modify (I have already made three modifications for bombs when you open the wings, a place to put a scanner, and a lightsaber storage place)

Cons:

1. I think it should come with another clone pilot, not Kit-Fisto, but he is cool

Get it if you have the money! Type in Lego.com go to ''Shop'' and... well you get my point.

author: superdave
title: Not Bad If You Can Get It On Sale
review:
I was fortunate enough to pick this up at 15% off at Toys 'R' Us last night (I paid about US$51 plus tax). I love fun spaceships and this set has multiples of several new parts, so I decided to take the plunge.

The build was hefty but had some drawbacks: it's easy to build some sections (especially the wing-split mechanism) incorrectly; the 3x6 slope "windows" look like good handholds for swooshing but the weight of the ship could cause the single-stud connections to fail, smashing the ship to the floor; and the modular nature of the construction results in a somewhat floppy final product (connecting the wings to each other through the fuselage might be possible, allowing the wings to be firmer). There are a couple of gaps near the cockpit windshields; they could easily be filled by removing the hinges if you don't want your clone pilots to "suffocate" in "space."

The parts selection is great: new 2x1 cheese slopes and 2x4 tiles were two of the big reasons I picked this up. The dark red parts, including hinge bricks and wing plates, and minifig parts added to the fun.

This thing is big! Wider than it is long, small hands and short arms may have trouble zooming this around the house- and again, I think it's safer to hold this by the bottom of the fuselage than it is by the top. The "torpedo" shooter isn't strong (flick-fire missiles launched by a technic axle assembly) but the wings open and close and the rear guns can tilt and turn.

Even on sale, the ARC-170 isn't cheap ($.13 per element after discount; themes like Space Police and Power Miners average near $.12 per element at full price). Make sure you want this set before you buy. I'm happy with the parts- lots of new bits and new minifig elements- and the build (despite the floppiness). It's not a must-have, especially if you have the previous incarnation of this ship, but it is a great-looking rendition of one of the key starships of the Battle of Coruscant.

author: joelmama29
title: ARC-170 Vs. ARC-170
review:
Well where can I start! Several years ago I bought the original ARC-170 and I would have to say that was one of my favorite setts because of teh detail and the mini figs. So when I heard that Lego was rereleasing the ARC 170 I was wondering how Lego would make it better. Having to compare the new ARC to the orignial ARC that I own I would have to say if you combine the two you will have one perfect ARC 170. The original ARC has detail printed pieces and the new one has stupid stickers that you can never get them on quite straight. But the new ARC is has a better build design, and is very sturdy. I love the engines on the wings they are bigger and bolder. The front end is more like the ship in the movie and the ship is wider and heavier. Another pro is the mini figs. You get two clone pilots, new astro droid, and KIT FISTO! Kit Fisto is great if you were not able to get him in the Obi Jedi Fighter/Hyper Drive Ring set. Great job Lego on the Mini Figs not just making the same clone pilots but giving us original mini figs. This gave this set a 4 it would have got a 5 but stickers drive me crazy. Lego please go back to printed pieces I will pay more! If you have a chance though to buy this set get before people sell them for overinflated prices. Just for fun I think I am going to combine some of pieces from the original ARC to the new and make a perfect ARC-170 for my collection. 

PROS:

Mini Figs 
  Captina Jag
  Clone Pilote 
  Kit Fisto
  R4-P44

Sturdy Build 
More Detailed Look than the Original ARC 
Great Design and Build 

CONS:

STICKERS STICKERS STICKERS STICKERS

author: ian
title: Pure Awesomeness
review: The ARC fighter is fantastic lego set. Everything about it is just fantastic. But let's start off with the minifigures. Kit Fisto is included in this set, he is very well detailed and the silver lightsaber hilt is nice. The new clone pilots are the bomb! I especially like captain Jags helmet. Their torsos are very well detailed but their legs lack any printing at all. the green astromech droid is really good looking. I think he's better than R2 D2. Now onto the ship. everything is big beautiful and detailed. The ships utterly massive yet surprisingly swooshable. It's got some pretty neat features. The S foil wings, the flickfire  bombs, opening cockpit is all great. Speaking of the cockpit, they have controls score! The only thing that can match the fighters size is it's price. 75 euros! Good grief! But the fighter is worth every last penny. The droids might as well take coffins into the battlefield with them when the ARC is around.! You won't regret buying this!

author: namekuji
title: Straight to spare parts.
review:
A horrid remake of the 2005 arc-170, (which is quite rare for a remake to be worse than its counterpart).

This model does have that horrible 'slapped together' feel as a result of it's unsealed cockpits, incomplete underside and ill designed backside. As for price, just outrageous!

(nice flick mech though). Those pilot helmets are cool in the pictures but because they are flat on the backside, just dont look good in real life. To add insult to injury, it is a sticker heavy model. Even the cockpit computers are stickers (or have nothing at all)!! Seriously wrong for a classy warbird like this.

Good for spare parts (except computers because there arent any). Give this model a miss. Get the 2005 one if you can and contrast the 2, that is a super spacecraft with nice computers, sealed cockpits and longer wings.

This model is lousy at best. I'll never build it again, just horrid.

author: Starstreak
title: Great set, but watch the price tag.
review:
I did a full review on another website, which you can view here.  Complete with pictures and even a comparison between this and the older 7259 set!
http://www.eurobricks.com/forum/index.php?showtopic=37948

Here is the closing for that review.

Comments: I'll start off as I normally do and rant about the price. This unit has 396pcs and going from the old standard of .10 cents a piece, this set should cost around $39.60. At the new standard rate of .17 cents a piece, it comes out to $67.32. I paid $67. Wow, I hit it right on the nose. But it's so hard to feel like a good deal to pay so much for so little pieces. BTW, TRU had it for $86.99. Click on it. My rant is done.
Overall I LOVE this set. I like most Star Wars Lego sets. It looks like what it's supposed to be, but what I don't like is when they previously released a set and they didn't improve on it by much. It is cleaner and more up to date, but as you read in the comparison of the old set, many things was done right the first time. Maybe if I can force myself to dismantle both sets, I'll make one set with the good of both sets.

My rating
Playability: 4/5 This is playable. Made for kids. Minifigs are nice, and where else can you get a green R2 head?

Design: 3/5 Right in the middle. Design is close. But many things that was good on the old set, they didn't use on this set. Like when they used printed pieces on the 7259 or a clear window instead of a fake sticker to look like a window.

Build experience: 3/5 It's made for ages 8+. My son can build this. But the stickers are a royal pain because this set uses a lot of clear stickers, and clear stickers are harder to remove without damaging the clear area of the sticker.

Overall: 4/5 I think this would make a great set. Get it for MSRP if you can. I know a lot of places are sold out, but more will come in.

author: captain_radda_radda
title: In one word: Outstanding
review:
I had some target giftcards left over from my splurging and stumbled upon this beauty at a very empty Lego isle. I got home and got to building immediately. The build was roughly and hour and the result was spectacular. In all honest, I can't think of any words to describe the perfection of this set. When compared to the last Arc, this one totally upstages it. The nose is the biggest improvement seeing as the origanal had a cracked one. Also, the missiles fire pretty well. One thing I'd like to add is the amount of space given in the gunner and co-pilot seats. There is enough room to even fit large headed characters like Ashoka. The crank system is much more refined so there is a less flimsy wing system. Kit Fisto has to be one of the best minis I've seen. Also, Jag and the pilot aren't bad either, but I kinda wish that they would have included a clone wars era pilot. Oh well, it is Ep III's 5th aniversery. 

Pros:
Price: $60 is more than fair considering the size
Minis: 4 rare figs that are currently exclusives
Sturdieness
Awesome looking

Cons:
Absolutely none

Overall:
Guys, this is seriously my new favorite starfighter and it really is beyond awesome. Get it if you need a cool starfighter that isn't as boring as the V-19 or as massive as the Y-wing.

author: Striker
title: One of the best fighters I have!
review:
Well to begin: This is a really good set! I wanted it ever since I saw it on MOCpages as perlimenary pictures.

Then about 3 months later I got for $58.99 at Target. I really was exited about the figures, the were much more accurate then the old clone pilots. The set has many good features,lots of playability and a very good price. WARNING: If you do something wrong in the S-Foil wings, it will not work properly.

Here are some pros and cons:

PROS:

  • Awesome Minifigs!
  • Really good ship.
  • Great price!
  • Gey a Tri-fighter and you can have a good space battle.

Very good set. (Overall)

CONS:

  • Flickfire Missiles.
  • If you do something wrong in the S-Foil wings, it will not work properly.
  • Build was`nt the best.

I reccomend this set to and SW Builder and fan!

-EC Striker

author: Dokuru_Chan
review:
Very nicely done LEGO.

I personally love this set my parents love it too and even my friends mom!
It took me to hours to build (because i was watching T.V. at the time)and I must say LEGO couldn't have done any better.The price was a little out of hand though.Also the only problems i had were the price to peice ratio and the rear turret is kind of flimsy.

Pros:Sleek'Comes with 4 minifigs including Kit Fisto and Captain Jag,FUlly improved from the old version.

Cons:Price,Wobbly rear turret.

But overall a great set!I reccomend it to all of those die-hard Star Wars fans out there!

author: Carl
title: Perfect!
review:
This set in my opinion is a very good Star Wars set. I've always liked the ARC-170s, and I was thrilled when they made the first one a few years ago, but I think that this one is better. All the minifigs are really cool, as the Clone Pilots are finally movie accurate ones. Also my brother got the old Kit Fisto set, so my envy was finally sated. The wing rotating mechanism is really well designed, and I love the way that when you push the cog it fires some flick fire missiles.

Pros
  • Kit Fisto
  • Movie accurate pilots
  • Cool starfighter
  • Wing rotating mechanism
  • Flick fire missiles
  • Three cockpits
  • Cool pieces
Cons
  • NONE!

Overall I think that the ARC-170 is a sset that every LEGO fan should get.

author: David1971
title: A very nice solid spaceship
review: The body of this ship is very sturdy-feeling and substantial, which is really nice. I built it in two hours, without trying to rush, which seems like a decent build time - not too short or too long. The minifigs are great - the pilot helmets are a nice new (I think) design, and it's nice that they're pilots with faces rather than boring clones with black featureless barrels instead of heads. And Kit Fisto is obviously the most unique and interesting. You get a good lot of white and dark-red parts, ideal for building other spaceships with the stuff that comes in the box. As others have noted, there are lots of stickers and Lego should print the pieces, not give us stickers. But on the other hand, it looks fine without stickers, if you don't want to put them on. Overall, a very pleasing and substantial ship.

author: Pepper
title: pure awesomeness
review:
I got this set at Sears in Baraboo, WI on clearance yesterday (5/1/2010) for the VERY reasonable price of $30. It is totally awesome!
 
Building experience: 3/5
The build is rather repetitive except for the main hull/cockpit. It was an enjoyable build except that the engines and wings are repetitive.
 
Parts: 4/5
The windscreens and turbo tank wheels are nice. There are 2 trans-pink discs that are very cool. also the inclusion of 9 new flat 2x4s.
 
Minifigures: 4/5
The minifigures are really cool. Kit Fisto is sweet with his silverish lightsaber. The clones are, of course necessary in a ship like this. And a new green R2! The only problem is the lack of a third pilot.
 
Playability: 5/5 (as long as you have vulture droids)
The playability is very good with moving wings, flick-fire bombs, and a moving laser cannon in back. It is wonderful for space battles as long as you have a vulture or hyena droid or a tri-fighter.
 

Pros.
Kit Fisto!
Clone pilots
New R2!
awesome ship
moving wings
flick-fires
9 new flat 2x4s
new 1x2 slants
trans-pink
big (aprox. 1 foot long, 1.5 feet wide)
 

Cons.
the Arc-170 is a FIGHTER, not a BOMBER
stickers
only 2 pilots
no weapons for pilots
Overall, one of the best Star Wars sets out there now. If you can find it for $30-40, BUY IT. Totally awesome.

author: blazetrooper501
title: AWSOME
review:
This is a cool set one of the things is that it has the same amount of pieces as the old one ill get to the pros and cons.

pros

rare kit fisto minifigure

new clone pilots

movie accurate

cons

overpriced by about 20$

lot of stickers

 

overall I would get this one if you couldnt get the old one.

author: THX_1138
title: Good but expensive
review:
The ARC-170 is one of my favorite PT SW ships. It reminds me of WWII bombers, and I love WWII fighter planes. The first set was quite good, but I think this one is a bit better.

Pros:

  • More accurate than the original, with the symbol on the nose, both rear cannons, and stickers on the cockpit pieces.
  • The minifigs are pretty good: Rare Kit Fisto and two exclusive clone pilots, one with a special helmet pattern (I'm too lazy to look up his name at the moment), as well as a new dark green R2-series droid.
  • The ship is great looking.
  • The ship has a mechanism for opening/closing the wings, which works quite well.

Cons:

  • The wings have too many studs, and should have more plates.
  • If you don't apply the stickers, it would look rather plain, and less accurate.
  • Quite pricey for the number of parts (I got mine at Target on sale while using a 10% off coupon, so I might have rated the set differently if I got it a full price).
  • Should have more figs, maybe another clone pilot.
This set is pretty good, although I would try to get it on sale.

author: legoclone
title: Improvement over 2005 version but still has faults
review:
Since I also own the 2005 ARC-170 this review is a comparison between the two.  
 
First of all I think the 2010 look is more accurate than the 2005 with its bigger engine cowlings, the under/over dual tail guns, the bigger wingtip guns, and the rounded out nose.  I am also glad Lego decided to go with the accurate flight helmets this time (although I would have rather had another crewmember to fill out the crew with all clones).   The 2005 had a problem with a big long cockpit gap at the floor level of the rear compartments but that is fixed in 2010.  However, the 2010 version now has cockpit gaps at all the canopy mountings.  They also didn’t fix the cockpit gap behind the forward pilot’s compartment which both version have.
  
The cockpit details are sparse, the controls are down on the floor, and the middle crewmember has a big exposed gear right behind him.  However, despite these issues there is at least space to work with for modifications on this version.  The 2005 ARC-170 rear crew compartment was too tight causing the rear two crew members to sit too low but this time around they have widened out the fuselage allowing you to fix that.  The wider fuselage also covers up some of the wing mechanics and overall makes it look better.  My only other beef is the use of a lot of stickers instead of printed pieces.  In the case of the canopy stickers though, if you get them on right, it looks a lot better than the older version.   Last and not least they mounted the S-foils with a lot better mounting scheme.  The 2005 version has the extender mechanism based on a single ball-on-tile strike plate with singe mounting point which caused the S-foils to tilt and lag back and forth when extended and it looked bad.  On the 2010 version the ball is replaced by technic link pieces with flat edges and each S-foil is mounted by side-by-side mounts so it is held parallel to the main wing at all times.  
 
Overall the kit is good enough to replace my 2005 ARC-170 (although I will be using pieces from that one to improve the few faults in this one).   I also thought it was a little pricey for a 396-piece kit.   The Clone War Y-wing is the same price and has 174 more pieces.

author: EtudeTheBadger
title: 'Do A Barrel Roll!'
review:
Well, despite my rants during my 2005-era ARC-170 review about this set, I finally caved and decided to pick the 2010 model up today. I said that the model sounded awful, and the stickers would ruin it.
Is it awful? Do the stickers ruin it?

Well, let's go deep here, huh? The ARC-170 2010 is a hefty beast, make no mistake. It's got bigger engines, bigger guns, bigger cockpits... well, let's just say bigger everything. It's a 'Super Size Me' version of the previous model. But is it better?

Yes!... and, no.

The build is excellent, to start. If you've built the original model back in 2005 or whenever, well, there's little new to be honest... initially! The undercarriage is the same, just uses more pieces, and there's no bomb dropping action- rather, a pair of flick fire missiles occupies the belly of the ship. Everything pretty much proceeds as normal until the nose- the nose on this one is a lot more detailed and movie realistic- even down to the Incom symbol on the sides. More chunky pieces are used, making the nose more substantial. The forward cockpit has a control panel, too! The rear cockpits are a new story, also- rather than the sides of the ship opening, it's now easy to simply put figures in due to a wider body, and the sides are fixed in place. Well... it's more solid than the 2005 one, without any pieces breaking off. The rear turret is also genius. Two guns are linked through a rear turntable mechanism, and can be angled for a precise aim. They can also be tightened, preventing any annoying swivelling when manoevring the ship- a real problem with the 2005 version, which had a very badly-designed gun in comparison. The wings are where this model has the clear advantage! Whereas the 2005 model's wings were flimsy and sometimes difficult to position correctly, the new foils are held on with double the parts, doubling the durability of the foils and also the model. The guns are also much improved- they're built with Technic axles instead of poles, and look a lot more... butch. To top it off, the pilots look more movie realistic- they've got no faceplates, giving a good look at their faces, which I'm sure every Star Wars fan like me likes to see in a minifigure- realism! R4-P44 the astro-droid and Kit Fisto are our guest stars, and they're pretty much worth the £50 alone. I didn't say that!

Well, it sure looks like the new ARC-170 has the old one licked, huh?

Unfortunately, no. There are cons with this model that do it down, and they're some pretty big ones. Right, I'm going to hit the biggest one- and that's the stickers!

By. The. Force! I've never seen so many of those darn labels! One thing that really spits in my blue milk is that LEGO can't even be bothered to transfer the circular symbols any more- even they have to be stuck down now! The stickers on the cockpit canopies were painful to put on, as were the side stickers. For £50, would it be too much to ask LEGO to roll on some transfers? The fact that even the cockpit HUDs were stickers just adds to what is already a so-ridiculous-it's-comical situation. The 2005 model had no stickers and looked good- if it ain't broke, don't fix it! Moving on now. THe cockpit panels are also lacking in placement. Why have only two, ever? Both ARC-170s have this problem- why not just put three panels in- for the two pilots and the gunner?! Also, there are only two pilots. Where's the third? At least the original had all three. Also, there's just not that sense of creativity that permeated the older version. Although the build was great, this one felt a little lacking in some way. It was also a lot less colourful- the original had lights and a stripe of light green here and there.

Moreover, the parts used here existed back in 2005- none are relative to now! Why not just make this model back in 2005?!

Okay, maybe I've digressed. The 2010 ARC-170 is, overall, a worthy build, but consider the pros and cons, comin' atcha!

  • Pros:
  • Great new look
  • Elements of the ship are bulked up
  • Looks more like the movie!
  • R4-P44 makes this set
  • Pilots look fabulous
  • Kit Fisto... again, but he's cool
  • Wings and foils stay on
  • Better rear cockpits
  • Cons:
  • STICKERS!! Everywhere!!
  • Cockpit panels are a little badly placed
  • Two clones- not every ARC has Kit Fisto in it!
  • Feels a little too... well, lacking...
  • Less colourful
In short- No, it's not awful. But yes, the stickers do detract. This is a two-edged sword of a model- superior design and details, but much of it is reliant on those reviled stickers. Get it if you're not obsessive about those, but more devoted detail junkies are better off with the 2005 one. Or, if you have both, combine! It's something I'm considering!

-maaboo35

author: Blackicep8ntball
title: Far too many stickers; not wild about Kit Fisto's rubber head. But it is a big set.
review:
This is a big set, and it's not bad looking. The factors that influence my overall opinion:

Building experience: has a few technic parts, which aren't my favorite to put together. Slightly repetitious sometimes. No new building techniques. Overall, just average.

Parts: I purchase Lego sets for the long haul.
- the stickers: I've played with them for nearly twenty years, and I've seen how stickers hold up. This set has more stickers than any Lego set I've ever purchased. Even the small round emblems on the wings are stickers; this is unnecessary, especially considering that that emblem has been on other sets as a printed piece. The stickers are also partially clear, and if you get ANY dust or fuzz on the sticky side, it's there and visible on your set forever. On the plus side, the stickers seem like decent quality stickers, so they're not going anywhere. But they're still stickers and they make the set feel cheap.
- Kit Fisto's Head: the alien minifigure's head is rubber, and in my experience rubber doesn't hold up in the long run like plastic does. In my opinion, a plastic head would have been better.
- Other parts: pretty traditional. Lots of big pieces.

Playability: The set is big, and the mechanism for firing the bombs is not bad. Not a fan of the flick-fire missiles, but this is different. Fairly "swooshable" as they say. Perhaps a little flimsy.

Value for money: Price per piece, this is an expensive set. However, I will say that it's big. Price per square inch of plastic isn't so bad. Fewer big pieces instead of tons of little pieces. So this set is just average here. Would have enjoyed PRINTED PIECES for the price, Lego.

author: TheHiddenFear
title: larger than it seems...
review:
When i finished this set i thought to myself "wow! this thing is Huge! it is huge, about the size of the lego star wars Republic Gunship. I enjoyed building this set, and i love a the features it has. first of all, the guns on the wings are huge! and there also are missiles under the body. there are three cockpits for the Captain Jag, Kit Fisto, and Clone Pilot minifigures. i think that the cockpits shoud've been designed better because in the second cockpit, you can see the technic wheel piece that raises and lowers the wings. stickers are also a con to this set, there are too many stickers, i think Lego could do a better job than this. some pros are that there are 3 awesome minifigures, and the cool wings.

Here are some pros and cons:

pros:

-cool minifigures

-its huge!

-fun to build

-wing mechanism works good

-cool new pieces

-great addition if youre building an army

 

cons:

-lots of sticker

-cockpits-need to be designed better

-clones should come with weapons

 

Overall- 4.5/5

author: Gerranamo101
title: 8088 ARC-170 Starfighter
review:
To be very honest, I always thought the old ARC-170 was pretty lame. I don't actually own it but a good friend of mine does, the wings bend and then brake, the body was too flimsy and the whole thing just lacked in design.... And then they made this....


After selling a few of my gift-cards to my mum I finally had the $140.00 to buy this set. I didn’t actually know what I was going to buy that faithful day but when I saw that this had finally been released I just had to have it. At first I was pretty stumped by the price, but at the end of the day it was all worthwhile.

 

The first thing I realized about this set was the brand new episode III clone pilot and Captain Jag. They are so much better than the old pilots, complete with new helmets with a gap for sight, a new head with a face with an orange visor added above the eyes and a new body. There are three cockpits on this craft; two situated facing the front and one facing behind, which controls the rear turret. Fortunately there are only two clone pilots in this set so you end up with an empty cockpit. There are also another two minifigures that come with this set: Kit Fisto and R4-P44. Kit Fisto is not a new minifigure, he is also seen in the 7661 Jedi Starfighter with Hypodrive Booster Ring. But R4-P44 is a never before seen droid only available in this set, and his cockpit sits directly between the second and third cockpits.

 

 

The old ARC-170 came with a bomb dropping mechanism mounted on the bottom, which I found quite nice, this set does not come with this but Lego has replaced bombs with flick missiles. To be very honest with you, to begin with I thought the bombs were quite a lot better than flimsy flick missiles. But after awhile the flick missiles began to make a lot more sense. A Technic gear piece sticks out the back of the ARC which if pushed into the ship the flick missiles fly out just under the front cockpit.

 

The older ARC-170’s engines, wings and blasters were pretty pathetic. Lets take the engines for example: They were undersized which didn’t give the ship that bulky look. Because of their size they also didn’t make the ship feel the way it should (by holding it/ weight). The modern ARC-170’s engines are beast, made up of one Clone Turbo Tank wheel per engine at the front, a few thinner pieces around the middle so the wings could hold on, and it then smoothes out at the back; A true Lego masterpiece. The wings on this set are much better than the wings on it’s older brother, instead of the wings snapping and falling off they are much more stable and are held onto the ship with more reliable pieces. I must admit though, the wings do bend a little bit, but that’s ok because the wings will always bend a little on a ship with this design. The blasters on the end of each wing are also a large improvement. They stand out more, making the ship look tank, they are also longer instead of shorter stubby pieces with blue studs at the end.

 

Like every ARC-170 in the universe there are four smaller wings on the larger wings (two per wing) one on the top and one on the bottom. The gear piece at the back of the ship is also used for raising these sub wings as well as firing flick missiles. From the cockpits they rise to roughly about 160 degrees. This look gives the ARC-170 an outstanding visual appearance.

 

The last but not least feature I am going to review is the rear turret. It is controlled by whoever is in the rear cockpit. The turret’s heights are changeable throughout an angle of 90 degrees upwards and then back down. Unlike the old ARC this turret has two blasters, not just one, one directly in front of the rear cockpit and the other about 4cm under the other one.

 

If you are thinking about buying this set but you’re just not sure whether it’s worth the price then take my word for it, this set is a beauty; every Lego Starwars collector needs one. The number on the price tag may end up being a hurdle for you. But when you finally convince your dad to buy it for you, you’re on the long straight home. Every space battle needs one.

 

Gerranamo101

author: Brickman_oo_
title: Greatest lego build ever!
review: This may be the BEST star wars ship out. I have built many lego sets, and this was the hardest build yet. There were so many technical pieces and it was really confusing. I had to redo one part of the set because I was confused, but it still is a great build. The figures are AWESOME. You get two new lego clone pilots and KIT FREAKING FISTO. The pilots helmets are a little big, but they look really cool. This set is also the BEST star wars ship out because of a little gear at the back of the ship. It can shoot two flick-fire missiles and it also can turn the ship into attack mode by raising two little wings on each side of the ship. This set is very creative and it is a hard build, but I suggest you get it!

author: Legonat
title: My favorite(so far) STAR WARS starfighter!
review:
I wanted this set ever since it came out in January 2010,and now,its finally mine!

           Pros

  •            Four minifigs (Kit Fisto, Captain Jag, Clone pilot, and R4-P44),
  •            Challenging and fun to build,
  •            Good parts (Large White wheels, Silver lightsaber handle, and Republic vessel Symbols),
  •            Double gear features (Turn it and the wings open, push it and the missiles fire)

          Cons

 

  •            Why have stickers when there are other pieces that have decals instead?,
  •            The wings take forever to fold out or back in,
  •            Kit Fisto's lightsaber with get the silver paint scratched off if it is used too often,
  •            Kit Fisto's head is made of rubber and therefore will get scratched up pretty bad

           Overall a 5/5

author: spencer_tucker
title: Clone Wars ARC-170
review:
I was really excited when I saw Lego was coming out with this set, since I never got a chance to get the Episode 3 version.

 

Pros:

-Large
-New Clone Pilots
-Kit Fisto (not really rare anymore)
-Astromech
-Great Playability
-No real flick fires
-Nice overall design
-Great Functions

 

Cons:   


-Stickers
-Rotating gun on the back spins back and fourth while you "fly" the ship

Really great set, recommended buy.  Great for Clone Wars fans.

author: Snowtrooper76
title: Un set Star Wars magnifique !
review: Inspiré en partie du X-Wing pour l'ouverture des ailes, ce set est de toute beauté. Qualité, couleurs, nombre des personnages, un véritable plaisir de le construire. Je le recommande à tous les fans. Le seul détail "gênant" est le poids aux extrémités des ailes, mais des pièces sont prévus sous le dessous pour que l'objet ne plie pas. J'espère que Lego nous livrera encore de beaux ensembles comme celui-ci.

author: Skyboss
title: yes, its great
review:
I got this set today and finished it in about 30-35 min. It is larger than i expected. It looks pretty good alone and looks right in a hangar next to any other republic fighters, even the old 170. Anyway, on to the review!!
The build. This set took me a shorter time than normal for this set type, I do have the other arc 170 and the build is similar. The build is segmented into three bags, fuselage, engines and wings. The fuselage has three cockpits and a space for an R2 unit and one is included. (he's green and his name is R4-P44)Lego includes two stickers to put on a slanted part to turn it into a control panel. The underside includes twin rocket luanchers under pilot #1.
The clones. These clones are how the ones from episode 3 SHOULD look. They have open helmets and you can see their faces. The two clones are Capitan Jag and a regular pilot. the set includes Kit Fisto, jedi master. The only weapons included are the lightsaber and the cannons on the starfighter. No weapons for the clones? Thats sad. 
Overall. This set is a good set to start a fleet. Its larger than it seems and has many features.(I'm not going to spoil the fun). The minifigures are top notch and to improve this set, give the clones some guns and get rid of the bottom cannon. The 170 i know has only one cannon for the tail gunner to work. It swivels a lot so watch out movie makers.

author: Firox_5000
title: Return of the arc-170
review:
Purchased this from Argos for £49.99.

 

The set includes two new clone figures with pilot uniform on as well as a cool  jedi called Kit fisto. and a cool new r2 unit called  R4-p44.

 

the ship is quite similar to the 2005  one except it has some new pieces on the nose,wings,engines and that the sides of the cockpits dont open.

 

Although the build is similar to the last one many of the features are quite different aswell. There are push fire missiles. ON the 2005 one there was dropping bomnbs instead. There are more guns on the back of the ship too. The ships main feature which is opening wings is exacly the same function as the original but is a nice feature.

 

Compared to the last one this set is quite a good improovement but is yet more expensive than the original by £15 I think. For £50 it only has 396 pieces which is quite low for a star wars set but compared to the recent Palpatines shuttle set which is £10 more for a similar sized set this seems much better value.

 

If you have £50 availible I suggest you get this set.

author: Niallskie
title: Better ship than before... maybe??
review:
I had this set for quite a while but just opened it and build it today. I actually loved the minifigures on this set, pilots are awesome specially Kid Fisto. When I started to build the set, it looked a bit like the 2005 Arc 17. One of the best part of the set is the front of the ship. It looked better and is actually better as it is more sturdy and had an awesome brick construction on this set. Another one I loved is the maroon engine, its the first time I have seen this kind of brick and it looked fantastic. The wing of the Arc 17 is a bit flimsy, but you can expect that as the wing is really wide. The thing that worries me about the two small wings on each side, was the black piece that connects them to the main ship is not supported. True that the lego fits firmly but in time lego tends to be a bit loose, and it having no support may fall apart in time. On this set too the stickers are a hasstle, specially comparing this to the 2005 sets where the bricks are printed is really no contest. Even the side bricks that used to be a see tru window is just white brick and a sticker, not really giving this set justice.

 

     The sticker I do appreciate are the ones that go to the cockpit windows, it makes it look more awesome though hard to put in if your not a sticker expert. The gear that you turn at the back side of the ship to make the wings open are kinda too near the rear end and makes it a bit hard to turn, while having the torret gun at the back swinging wildly. Other than those stuff, this set is actually fantastic and way way better than the 2005 set. It is actually worth the price specially if you get this at a discounted price, like how I did.

author: Matt_mason
title: Need to get more Star Wars sets now
review:
I saw this set on offer from amazon.co.uk thanks to brickset Read the reviews and thought why not. I am a lego train fan at heart and only had a few of the small SW sets.
Ordered it thursday evening arrived sat afternoon so off to a good start.
The set is a very good build but must admit to getting the folding wing gear wrong twice !
But managed it in the end. The included mini figures are all very nice. I have a thing for mini figures too.
The finished craft is very close to the real thing.
The build is good  bit tricky in places but enjoyable (went better when I put my glasses on)
Not many stickers (NOT a fan of them)
Mini figures are great all 4 of them and R4-P44 is cute.
Set is quite large when finished.
So I will admit this kit has changed my mind on the Star Wars theme and look forward to getting more.

author: Grand_Titan
title: "Set S-foils To Attack Positions"
review:
First, I Was Excited When I Gived This Because It's Big And Freaky Awesome. I Build This While Ramadan (I'm Islam).Ok Now Go To Opinion


Building Experience


The Building Is Hard Especially When Building Engines And Wing, But Building The Body Is Easy.I Build It When Dawn While I Fasting.


Parts


The Parts Is Useful For Making MOC, But I Hate The Rubber Band And Technic Parts Because It's Quiet Rare Used In MOC.But Some People In Flickr Use The Rubber Band For Minifig Accessories.


Playability


The Playability Is Good Because It's Has Flick Missile And S-Foils Mode. The S-Foils Are Slow.I Rare Playing With It Because It's Heavy And Little Pain When I Grab It Because My Finger Touch The Gear.


Value For Money


I Agree With Other People That Mark This Set OverPriced.


Conclusion


Buy It.

author: Takeshidude
title: Pure Awesomeness
review:
This is an awesome ship, so I had to buy it. Although I personally prefer the original 2005 version, this one is still epic. It comes with a ton of uncommon/rare parts and the now clone pilot. Kit Fisto appears for again (first in Jedi Starfighter sith Hyperdrive Ring) along with the exclusive R4-P44 astromech. On to the list.

Pros
*Awesome pieces
*Exclusive R4 unit
*Kit Fisto (with new chrome lightsaber hilt)
*New clone pilot and Captain Jag.
*Impressive wingspan
*Swooshable
*Lighter than it looks
*New cockpit windshield
*Huge box :P

Cons
*Lasers look too realistic
*Cockpit hinge will come off on occasion
*Playability is rather low (unless you have a separatist fighter, or an imperial fighter)

Overall I highly recommend this set.

author: LEGOSLUG
title: Droid Attack? NO CHANCE-not with this flying around!
review:
Here´s my review of LEGO set 8088 ARC170 Starfighter.


The Minifigures:

* Kit Fisto--Jedi Robes, Chrome lightsaber.
* Captain Jag--New style Clone pilot torso and helmet

* Clone Pilot--New style Clone pilot torso and helmet

* R4-P44--Pretty much a green R2-D2.

All of these minifigures are unique to the set, apart from Kit Fisto, he is in sets 7661-Jedi starfighter with booster ring and  852947--a magnet set.


The Build:

1) The Body.
The main body structure is strong, I think that´s owing to the fact the is a new/rare element that houses the cog to expand the wings. However, it is also strong because the pieces overlap, giving it a pleasing look to the eye, but making it strong at the same time. There are a few stickers , but they are easy to apply. The body has a more sleek and aerodynamic look compared to the 2005 version, and this set has missiles, not bombs.

2) The Wings.
The Central wings on either side of the body are built and attached first. This is because the wing turning mechanism is housed at the joint of the wing, as the joint uses elastic bands, this is a good place to put it, because nothing could make them ping off.

Next are the upper and lower wings, each a replica of each other, the only difference being that the top wings have the republic emblem on them. These attach to the main body, and open outwards to let the ship enter attack mode. These wings are strong, they don´t break.

This is one of the few Star Wars models you can actually pick up and even fly around without it breaking.

Now, on to the Pros and Cons.

Pros

* Unique Minifigures.
* Strong Starfighter.
* Fires missiles.
* The wings open.
* A new element

Cons

* STICKERS, not many, but they are there.
* Sometimes the cockpit screens break off, but not often.
* No one to fight, solve that problem by buying 8086, Droid Tri-Fighter, or one of the new Battle Packs, 7913, and 7914.

All in all it is a brilliant set, add it to your Star Wars collection.

A great set for Play OR Display.


LEGOSLUG

P.S. Please see and rate my other reviews and bricklists.

author: mihkmagne
title: Great Set But Kinda Flimsy
review:
This was my first clone starfighter and I loved it while it lasted, because it broke about two-three months post-construction.
Pros:
Cool Pilots
Kit Fisto
Expanding Wings
R4-P44
Cool Weapons

Cons:
395 pcs, $55
Middle Wings Flimsy
Flick Missiles don't go far

But the Pros are so positive its worth it if you don't have annoying little bros like me!

author: StratTone
title: What an ugly ship but......
review: .....was a blast to build.  This is another ship that was shockingly fun to build and I gained a new perspective of this ship after building.  For some reason this ship (like many) after building seems to gain more appreciation from me when I see them on screen.  I still don't care for the huge engines but building this ship prompted me to read a little about it.  After learning more of this ships origian I now see a nice B-17 esq star fighter when I look at it.  Go for it this one if you haven't.

author: LEGOSweden
title: Not at all better than the 2005 Version,
review: This ARC-170 Starfighter or HeadHunter is not better than the Original. This rendition is the CLONE WARS Cartoon Version, Whereas the 2005 Version is the CLONE WARS Episode III Revenge of the Sith Saga Version. I have to say I was disappointed with this set. The stickers are incredibly unnecessary in all LEGO Sets. The older Version has STUNNING Printed pieces of pure Quality. When I compare this set to the original, even though this set does have a nice front which looks stylish and quite elegant and smooth, the 2005 Version just has something about it that makes it look so much better. Maybe it's the fact that it's the identical design from Revenge of the Sith, unlike this Cartoon Version from the CLONE WARS Animated TV Show. I also think the 2005 Versions Engines look so much better with a more detailed and accurate design. Certain design features of the 2005 Version make it looks smooth and exceedingly accurate. Unfortunately for me this set isn't better than the original and really shouldn't have been made in the first place, Yuck!

author: puCrepeaP
title: Nice looking fighter
review:
It's a good looking fighter.  I can't say there is much wrong with it, but it doesn't quite WOW me like others might.

Pros

  • Great Swoosh factor
  • Big Engines are a nice look. Overall they got the look of the ship down.
  • I like the mini figs.  
  • pretty big set

Cons

  • The wings don't open as well as I'd like
  • Doesn't pop

Yeah, really don't have much to say about this set.  It's nice and big, and a lot of fun to play with.  I had this and was debating on getting the new x-wing model, but thought this might be too similar.  I got the x-wing and like it a little better, but together they actually look great together, giving you an idea of where the xwing came from.  It's a unique design, with some familiar features like big engines (like a jumbo jet might have), and the wings the split like the xwing.

Overall a good set.

author: SanMams91
title: Excellent ARC-170
review:
Parts

This set came with various interesting parts, many of which could be used for MOCing.

Minifigures

You got two clone pilots, one was Captain Jeg (I think), and a rubbery Kit Fisto. Honestly, you got this set for the ship itself, not the figures. 

The build

Build was very fun and actually interesting at some points. I liked especially how LEGO had you build the nose of the fighter. Very clever. One qualm I had though was always going to be about the wings. The technic bits were just very repetitive at times, and could irritate you. Otherwise, solid build.

The completed model

This is a magnificent Starfighter model. It's got flick-fire missiles that fire once you push a stud from the back of the ship, the wings open and close beautifully, and the ship itself is extremely fun to swoosh around. 

Overall opinion

It's a great ship, but I'm afraid my one big downside for this set was its price. Ridiculously high for almost 400 pieces, but considering that that's been steadily improving over the years, it's a problem of the past. If you're looking to purchase one nowadays, I'm afraid paying over the retail price would be worse. If it's one of those ships you absolutely must have no matter what, then nobody's stopping you. If it isn't, however, save your cash for something cooler. Glad I have this set regardless.

author: Nuruodo
title: Huge clone starfighter
review:
The ARC-170 appears in Star Wars: Episode III, in which it shows its great firepower and the skills of its pilots. I was very fascinated from it in the movie, and so I decided to bought it. The Lego version is really good, although some cons I'll tell later.

Parts

I'm sure it has pretty rare parts, for example rotors and cockpits. It is made first of all by white pieces, then by dark red ones. You'll find a lot of white triangular parts, used for the wings.  

Minifigures

Minifigures are unique (except Kit Fisto). In fact, you won't find these two pilots in any other set (only some Episode III starfighters got similar minifigures, but without light blue gear). Also Kit Fisto is nice, with his particular head. The astromech droid is identical to R2-D2 with different colors.

The build

I remember that I enjoyed the build of the central body: it's like a very thick boat, at the start, while it becomes more and more full of details, finally becoming what you see on the box. Wings, as usual, were the worst part to build, but the presence of opening mechanism made my play with them a lot, trying it repeatedly. Also the cannons were funny to build.

The completed model

The completed model is big, surely one with the greatest wingspan (I think it should be just a little bigger than Z-95 Headhunter). I still very like its appearance, because it seems very recent. I particularly like the cannons, that are quite complex: they have two weapons each, and they aren't made just by them, but they include a solid base. As I said before, the opening mechanism works very well. There is also a missile launcher that I didn't play, but that will surely make someone happy.

Overall opinion

I really like this set. It wasn't cheap, and I knew just few time ago that the price-per-piece was very very high (I paid it 70/80€), but however it appeared to me worth the cost. And as it appears, bigger and made by more pieces than it really is, it's surely worth it. I found it very enjoyable, with these big guns, the missiles and the opening wings; they make you feel like clone pilots when the order of opening S-foils is given. 

Pros:

– Wings mechanism very well done

– Accurate details, especially the cannons

– Correct proportions and similar to original model

– Very rare minifigures

Cons:

– Wings are pretty easy to break

– The price-per-piece ratio is one of the highest (especially in euros)
